This is an old technique used to rip people off (Brittania music anyone?). Not impressed at all. Shape up Vodafone! This is sneaky, underhand and not how I expect to be treated as a customer.

I've given up trying to solve my problem. They owe me just over £20 due to billing issues and after ringing up several times over the last two months I've lost the will and not going to bother.The call centre staff are friendly but have no knowledge or power to solve anything.EDIT: After seeing this post I was contacted by a UK customer support office who had a lot more technical knowledge than the usual call centre staff and solved the refund instantly.
Average customer service. Best network though.

Trying to end my contact by phone. Always busy. At lest 40 minute wait. Still unable to get through. Will have to spend an afternoon waiting in the shop at this rate. Poor customer service. Extortionate contracts that never remain the same.

I have had many issues with Vodafone over the past year. However my credit check passed successfully with them and not with other providers so I thought I'd go ahead as at least I have a new phone! With this contract I won't be paying by Direct Debit. Instead I will do it manually to ensure that the bills are correct and to ensure that no overcharged amounts are taken from my bank. I agree with the reviews here on Trustpilot and personally I wouldn't have chosen Vodafone a second time. However at least I have a new phone out of it! So I can't really grumble...

It took time to sort out the broadband before it actially worked (days). Part of the problem was the lack of technical knowledge at the call centre and an inability to do anything but follow the computer screen prompts at their end. The gentleman that solved the problem was great but even he was annoyed with the mess.Re the free gift.... the marketing company should be sacked and never used again. There are problems in getting in contact with them as there are a lot of unhappy customers without gifts, in particular a speaker that has now lost a quarter of its value before I've got it. Added to that an inability to communicate the correct information to me I now feel the whole gift thing was a big con.If Vodafone is offering the best deal for you then great. Any gift offered is a bonus if it arrives.
Very good signal most of the time but they are more expensive than other networks. I was with them for a while but I then had to change
Average service, slow
Vodafone's Internet broadband is a bad choise.Continues failures and lower speed than i had with BT.
Reception ok, but dubious charges on the bill when I went abroad to Spain. Have complained and waiting to hear.

Spoke to agent on live chat reference upgrading my phone, I asked for a good deal as I have been a customer for shy of 10 years.  After minutes of hagling with the agent, a deal was struck, was I happy with it... sure.Order was put through and chat ended.I decided to check Vodafones web page to see how much I'd saved......LOL the same special offer given to me was staring me in the face, apart from the upfront cost of £30. So no special offer for a long serving customer,  I guess my loyalty wasn't really of interest to the agent. Thanks a bunch.

After lots of haggling and lots of misinformation from the call centres in Egypt, they did put me through to someone in the UK and they have given me the best deal I could find, so in that respect i'm very happy. £22 for 40Gb data unlimited txts and mins as well as spotify premium is very reasonable. However getting anything else sorted is an absolute nightmare. My mother switched the account into my name when I was 18, that was 6 years ago now and they are still billing her £4.17 every month for 6 years, on her credit file. But when they search her on the system there is no account in existence with her name to it. it's an absolute joke. So she can't even pay this supposed fee. There call centre staff just have no idea. Therefore I would suggest avoiding vodafone their billing system is an absolute mess.

I have been with Vodafone since 2015, all was well until 2 months ago when they started changing me for using my free data, after wasting hours chatting with them they sorted it out. And all was good, until now, for some reason they charged me double for this and next month. I spoke with them again, even went to a store, in the end thay said it was a glitch in the system and that they have fixed it. I am still waiting for my bill to find out. After my contract ends I don't know what I will do, I am disappointed with all the Asian and Indian people I have to talk with who don't even live in England... 3 stars go for the 1 and a half year of no problems
been with them for 11 months now and been good but didn't like how they charge to use phone in europe but three dosnt charge at all which i find really good

My husband rang  to upgrade my mobile phone contract as  the account is in his name. The first person he spoke made no effort to make a good deal. So my husband ended the call.He rang back 30 minutes later and got a more interested person who managed to find a deal for no upfront charge and over £8 per month cheap.Ring back if you don't get the deal you like is my advice
Been a loyal customer for many years - had many bad experiences but today was good. I felt the gentleman I spoke to was very understanding. Guess it's a little bit of luck who picks up the phone!
I have been with Vodafone for years. The network coverage is very good but they are quite expensive and when ever I try to call them the service is not that great

I had to go into my local shop in Basingstoke recently. I was met by someone who turned out to be the manager. His attitude stunk. I would have cancelled my contract and gone elsewhere, it was that bad.In the end i spoke to a young man, (think his name was Jo and he was quite new), who took time to listen to me, helped with the problems I was having and restored my faith in the store. He was fantastic.Because of Jo you've retained a customer. If it had been left to the manager, your have lost me and I'd have made sure I spread the word about appalling attitude.

I have used Vodafone for years, always finding their staff helpful.  However, since moving to a new area the reception on my phone has been poor.  It seems more and more these days other networks give better reception.

Been with Vodafone for over 20 years now , had 5 lines with them and although I have had issues ( some pretty ridiculous to be honest ) they have usually managed to sort me out in the end . Recently had problems ending an iPad contract . They disconnected the wrong line despite several contacts webchat and calls to make sure the error was corrected . They then didn't carry out the reconnection process and it took a call to the uk complaint line to get some decent action the operator was very helpful competent and efficient .the line was reconnected in 30 mins with. Thank you for that Vodafone ,please why can't you provide that service all the time .

Tricked into signing up as the salesperson promised me a discount that didn't materialise.Despite providing a transcript of our conversation I still had to jump through a 100 hoops to get the discount, which I now have.I do have an excellent deal and good coverage so I'm happy with vodafone itself but the customer service experience was a nightmare until finally resolved.
